title: Configure Service Portal feature settings
content:
Service Management provides default feature settings for the Service Portal.

To customize the settings, from the main menu, select Administration > Configuration > Service Portal Settings > Feature Settings.

After you change and save any feature settings, log out and log back in to the Service Portal to apply them.

You can change the following feature settings:

Self-Service settings

Feature selection

By default, all the following features are enabled. Select Off to disable a feature and remove all references to it from the portal.

  • Approvals
    • Approval delegation
      The default configuration allows delegation to all users. From the Allowed Delegations drop-down, select one of the following options to further configure it.
    • Show quick approval
      In Service Portal, by default, a dialog box opens and prompts users to add comments when users perform an Approve action.
      You can enable Show quick approval to display a Quick Approve button for users to approve without adding comments.
  • Q&A
  • Services and assets
    • Support offering link
      Allows you to manage the display of the Support offerings in the Self Service Portal.
  • Ideas
  • Request on behalf
  • Shopping cart
  • Live chat
Selection Description
Same company
  • If the Company field of a user is filled, then the user can only delegate to the users who are in the same Company, regardless of the users' Employment type.
  • If the Company field of a user is blank, then:
    • If the user's Employment type isn't External, the user can delegate to the users whose Employment type isn't External, regardless of the users' Company.
    • If the user's Employment type is External, the user can only delegate to the users whose Employment type is External and Company is blank.
Shared group membership A user may only delegate an approval to a user with whom there is a shared group membership.

Ribbon promotion

In the Ribbon promotion section, you can select which of the following links display in the top ribbon of the Service Portal:

  • Ask friends
  • Help friends
  • New request
  • Request on behalf
  • Suggest idea
  • Virtual agent
  • Your approvals
  • Your requests
  • Your services and assets

You can select up to four links to display.

Portal loading page

By default, the Service Portal light startup landing page is enabled. In the Enable portal loading page field, you can disable this by selecting Off.

If this option is enabled, on startup a standardized light landing page displays for users. While the portal loads in the background, users can:

  • Start typing a request description
  • Track their open requests:
    • View open requests
    • Accept or reject proposed solutions
    • Provide more information
  • View news

If users don't interact with the light landing page, it automatically closes when the portal loads.

You can neither customize nor rebrand the light landing page.

Portal profile page on first login

On the Service Portal, there is a profile page for the user to complete. By default, this displays automatically when the user logs in for the first time. In the Show portal profile page on first login field, you can disable this by selecting Off.

Virtual agent and email integration

Request offering on Self-Service Portal request

In Service Portal, you can configure how the user can create a request through "Create a standard support request" if there're no satisfactory results found from a search or from the virtual agent. This functionality is affected by whether there is a default offering in Service Request Management. Select the appropriate option in the Request offering on Self-Service Portal request field, as detailed in the following table. For more information, see Default offering.

Option Description
MANDATORY

The user is able to create a request:

  • If there is a default offering, a request will be created with the default offering.
  • If there is no default offering, the link of "Create a standard support request" is changed to "Select from categories", allowing the user to browse the categories for a matched offering.
OPTIONAL (default)

The user is able to create a request:

  • If there is a default offering, the request will be created with the default offering.
  • If there is no default offering, the user is directed to complete the general request form or Smart Ticket form if Smart Ticket is turned on.
IGNORE

The Create a standard support request link in the search result page is changed to fill in this form.

The user is able to create a request:

  • If there is a default offering, the request will be created with the default offering.
  • If there is no default offering, the user is directed to complete the general request form or Smart Ticket form if Smart Ticket is turned on.
SKIP

The user bypasses virtual agent support. 

When the user clicks Virtual agent:

  • If Smart Ticket is turned on, the user is directed to Smart Ticket page.
  • If Smart Ticket is turned off and there is a default offering, the user is directed to the default offering page.
  • If Smart Ticket is turned off and there is no default offering, the user is directed to the general request form.

When the user clicks "Create a standard support request" in search result page:

  • If there is a default offering, the request will be created with the default offering.
  • If there is no default offering, the user is directed to complete the general request form or Smart Ticket form if Smart Ticket is turned on.

When the user clicks Create a standard support request from the subscription or asset details page, the behavior is different from the content described in the above table:

  • If Request offering on Self-Service Portal is not selected as SKIP, the user is directed to Virtual Agent.

  • If Request offering on Self-Service Portal is selected as SKIP:

    • If there is a default offering, the request will be created with the default offering.

    • If there is no default offering, the user is directed to the general request form or Smart Ticket form if Smart Ticket is turned on.

Use the custom request form

Service Management provides a default request form that includes the following information:

  • Request description
  • User options
  • Attachments

You can customize the form to suit your company's needs. Follow these steps:

  1. In the Use the custom request form field, select Custom request form - customizable. By default, Default request form - pre-defined fields is selected.
  2. Click Save.

You can now customize the fields and layout by editing the Custom form for request records. For more information on how to edit forms, see How to edit a form.

If you want to enable users to edit requests in Service Portal, you can select the Customized form - with tracking and editing option. For more information, see Enable users to edit requests in the Service Portal.

Suggested links in email and virtual agent support

On the Service Portal, the ability to display links to the following, in specially prepared email messages and virtual agent support, is enabled by default. In this section, you can disable each type by selecting Off.

  • Articles
  • Q&A
  • News
  • Offerings
  • Public requests

Enable record creation and actions from email

In Service Portal, the ability for users to create records, add comments, and accept solutions directly from emails, without logging into Service Portal, is disabled by default. In this section, you can enable the function by selecting On.

  • If this flag isn't enabled, none of the other options relating to record creation and actions are enabled, even if those flags are set to On.
  • For this functionality to work, you need to install an On-Premises Bridge agent (on Windows or Linux) and configure an email integration endpoint.

Email integration mode


There are two integration modes to choose from, Agent and Integration Studio. If you choose the Integration Studio mode, you must provide a valid email address in the Email address for update record field. The Studio Integration mode is supported from 25.1 release. The default value is  Integration Studio.

Email address for update record

If you choose the Integration Studio mode for Email integration, you must provide a valid email address in the Email address for update record field.

Email integration agent

Contacts do not have login permission for Service Management. For the system to automatically process emails from contacts, you must set a default agent user. In History, the operations register as if done by the default agent user. In the Email integration agent field, you can enable this function as needed by selecting an agent from the drop-down.

Specify email validity time frame

You can specify the time frame for which emails that are sent from the Service Portal are valid. A user can perform the action specified in the email (such as accepting a request or selecting an offering from the provided suggestions) only during the specified time frame. The default value is 3 days. You can change the value to a number ranging from 1 to 90.

Enable approval through email

On the Service Portal, the ability to approve by email each of the following, is disabled by default.

  • Release approval
  • Article approval
  • Change approval
  • Request approval
  • Proposal approval

In the Enable approval through email section, you can enable each type by selecting On.

Miscellaneous

Enable agent anonymity

On the Service Portal, agent anonymity is disabled by default. In the Enable agent anonymity field, you can enable this function by selecting On.

If you enable this function, agents are anonymous during live chat sessions, when commenting in the Service Portal, and in email notifications. This means neither the avatar nor the name of the agent are displayed. Instead, the anonymous agent appears as Support Agent in all chats and comments on the Service Portal, as well as on notification emails.

If you enable agent anonymity, you must also configure it. For more information, see How to configure support agent anonymity. When you enable agent anonymity, if the Display the approval chain option is also enabled, only the name of the approval task will be displayed, while the approver or the approval group's name is hidden.

Enable article comments

In Service Portal, by default, public comments can be added to articles. In the Enable article comments field, you can disable this function by selecting Off.

Enable offering comments

In Service Portal, by default, public comments can be added to offerings. In the Enable offering comments field, you can disable this function by selecting Off.

Enable subscription comments

In Service Portal, by default, public comments can be added to subscriptions. In the Enable subscription comments field, you can disable this function by selecting Off.

Enable voting on articles

In Service Portal, by default, you can rate an article as helpful by assigning the article with a thumbs up vote.​⁢​⁡⁤‌​​ In the Enable voting on articles field, you can disable this function by selecting Off.

Enable voting on service offerings

In Service Portal, by default, you can rate the service offering as recommended when you submit a request. In the Enable voting on service offerings field, you can disable this function by selecting Off.

Configure public request location settings

This setting determines the hierarchy of location level that applies to public sharing of requests. In the Default location level for public request sharing field, select one of the following:

  • Country
  • City
  • Site
  • Building
  • Floor

The default value for this field is Building. For more information, see Public audience.

Enable and configure followers

On the Service Portal, the followers function is enabled by default. In the Enable followers field, you can disable this function by selecting Off.

You can configure the feature by limiting followers. The default configuration allows all users to be followers. Or, you can select one of the following from the Configuration for followers drop-down:

Selection Description
Same company

If the user who created the request has an Employment type of External, and the Company field isn't blank, only the following may be followers:

  • Users who are in the same Company and whose Employment type is External
  • Users whose Company field is blank and whose Employment type is External

If a user who created the request has an Employment type of other than External, only the following may be followers:

  • Users whose Employment type is other than External, regardless of the users' Company.
Shared group membership Only users in one of the same groups as the user who created the request may be followers.

For more information, see How to view and follow a public request in the Service Portal.

Target translation language

This feature works if you have enabled in-line translations in Application settings. For more information, see In-line translations.

On the Service Portal, the default target translation language is English (US). When a user does a search, if there are less than five results, Service Management automatically:

  • Translates the search text into the specified target language.
  • Searches using the translated text.
  • Merges both search results, and displays them to the user.

To change the target translation language, select the appropriate value from the drop-down.

Enable read-only display for closed requests

By default, having closed requests display as read-only is disabled. In the Enable read-only display for closed requests field, you can enable this and make all closed requests read-only by selecting On.

Enable entity picker smart suggestions

When enabled, certain pickers in the Request Management forms provide a list of suggested values at the top of the list based on the context of other fields in a record, such as the text in the Title and Description.

Enable the lookup button next to the drop-down menu of entity picker

By default, when you select records from a drop-down menu of entity picker, you may click the lookup button next to the drop-down menu to search or filter the records in a pop-up lookup table. To hide the lookup button in Service Portal, select Off.

Show the sidebar filter in the category page

By default, the filter for sub-categories appears at the top of the category page.
When you select On, the filter for sub-categories appears at the left sidebar on the category page.

Show the Featured tab in category page

By default, the Featured tab is hidden in the category page. You can show or hide the Featured tab on the category page by selecting On or Off.

Category page type

On the Service Portal, when a user clicks on a category tile, a page opens with tabbed sections. You can configure the default section that's displayed. Select the appropriate option in the Category page type field, as detailed in the following table.

Note: If there's no item under the default open tab, the system will automatically open the next tab to display the item list. 

Option Description

FEATURED (Out-of-the-box default)

A list of items in the following order:

  • All news items
  • Recommended offerings
  • Popular offerings
  • Articles

There may be up to 30 items in this section.
OFFERINGS

A list of offerings in the following order:

  • Recommended offerings
  • Popular offerings

There may be up to 20 items on each page of this section.
ARTICLES

A list of articles in the following order:

  • Recommended articles
  • Other articles

There may be up to 20 items on each page of this section.
NEWS

A list of news that belong to the category.
You may sort the news by:

  • Date
  • Importance

There may be up to 20 items on each page of this section.

Sort offering by

You can set the default sort order for the offerings in Service Portal by selecting POPULARITY or NAME. By default, the offerings in Service Portal are sorted by popularity.

Enable knowledge

By default, knowledge (articles and news) is enabled in Service Portal. You can disable knowledge by selecting Off. For example, if you don't use the Knowledge Management module in Service Management, select Off to prevent empty knowledge list from being displayed in Service Portal.

When you select Off, knowledge article related information is hidden in the following locations in Service Portal:

  • Global search result and suggested result
  • Side panel widget
  • Category detail page
  • Chat

If you select Off, you can only configure the Select category page type setting to "OFFERINGS".

Display the approval chain

The Display the approval chain option is enabled by default. You can disable this option by selecting Off.

When you enable this option, you can view the approval chain (which shows the past/future approver and approval group) of the records in the record details page. Note that when the Enable agent anonymity option is enabled, only the name of the approval task will be displayed, while the approver or the approval group's name won't be displayed. 

Display Mark as Solved button for support request 

In Service Portal, by default, the Mark as Solved button is displayed in the support request details page and to-do card. After executing this action, the phase of the support request changes to Abandoned. You can hide the Mark as Solved button by selecting Off.

Enable timer

The timer in Live Support to catch the initial handling time of a new request is enabled by default.

To disable this ability, follow these steps:

  1. In the Enable timer field, select Off.
  2. Click Save.

Auto-population of Person

By default, the Requested for field is automatically populated with the name of the current user or the user whom the current user is requesting on behalf of.
You can disable this function by selecting Off.

Recent request

By default, if Service Management is integrated with your Computer Telephony Integration (CTI) system, agents can view the recent requests of callers on the Live Support page.

You can disable this function by selecting Off.

Text input interval for search

This option defines a user's text input interval for search. If the system waiting time is longer than this interval, the system will start searching according to all characters entered by the user. The value must be equal to or greater than 500 ms.

Enable machine learning suggestions of Related Offerings in Global Search

By default, the setting is On and the Machine Learning sub-search logic applies for Related Offerings.

When you disable this by selecting Off, the IDOL-based search will bypass the machine learning sub-search logic.

This setting will impact the search results of Service Portal global search, suggested search results, and responses of IDOL based Virtual Agent.

The global search logic is composed of 2 groups of search queries:

  • Group A will search all data of the records for Offerings, Articles, Q&A, and Ideas. It also includes all personal requests of the user and all requests that have a public audience.
  • Group B will search all requests that have a related offering, irrelevant of the user that's logged in. The search has a Machine Learning sub-search logic, which is looking at all requests with offerings in the database. If there is a search hit on a request but not on its offering, it will take the related offering and add it to the overall search results in group B.

If the setting is On (default), up to 30 records of group A are shown in the search results, while up to 5 records of group B are shown in the search results. The results of group B are shown at the end of the results of group A with a different color background for easier navigation. 

If the setting is Off, the system will exclude the search from group B, which means the overall search results won't contain any hits on related offerings.

Enable session timeout alert

By default, when there are 10 minutes left before a session timeout, a pop-up message appears on top of the window. Users can select Continue to extend the session. You can disable this function by selecting Off.
